item.title: Homepage
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Interaction design apprenticeship

A fully funded work-study program to lunch your tech career
Harbour.space has partnered with SCG to empower driven talent and eliminate the barriers to accessing exceptional education and career opportunities through the masters fellowship. Enroll today

About the apprenticeship

Our Apprenticeship opportunities are designed to give talented and driven young people from any background access to top-class education, development opportunities and network. This offer includes a scholarship for a 12 month Master's degree in Data Science and work experience in an exciting gaming company with the possibility of a job upon graduation.

Application closes in:

0Days-0Hours-0Mintues-0Seconds

Location

Bangkok

Duration

1 Year Full-time

Start date

3 Aug 2021

End date

3 Oct 2022

Scholarship value

31,300 EUR

study commitment

3 hours / day

Work commitment

4 hours / day

a full-time contract

1 Year / Full-time

Pedro Bare Junior Interaction Designer

I don't think I'd be where am at now professionally if it wasn't for the education I received at Harbour Space. To produce your best work as a designer you have to be (1) Surrounded by ambitious peers striving to create great work (2) Receive guidance and instruction from practitioners that will push you beyond your comfort zone- Harbour Space did that for me and I'm forever grateful for the experience I had as a student there.

Diego Gladig Co-Founder, CFO

What a great year! Having done my Bachelors at the University of St. Gallen in Switzerland, it was a hard decision for me to come to Barcelona and study at Harbour.Space. However, after one year I can say that it was more than worth it. I have learned a lot about how to set up a company, heavily extended my network with decision-makers, met incredible classmates from all over the world and also learned 3 new programming languages (without being a data / computer science student).

Pavithra Krishnan Product Designer

The Interaction design Masters program has Industry leaders from Google, Anton & Irene, Friends, spending over 3 weeks with us to teach some really great modules. Quitting my job and moving to Barcelona was one of the best decisions Iâ€™ve made. I would recommend Harbour.Space to anyone who is open to challenging themselves.

Soninke Combrinck UX Designer

Wow! What an enriching educational experience! Coming from a journalism background in South Africa, I was interested in how to use interactive media to tell better stories. After learning from the best of the best, from creative geniuses from all around the world and constantly being pushed to improve and grow, I found my calling. Harbour.Space is the experience of a lifetime with unforgettable people and is well worth a shot.

    frequently
    asked questions

    Will I have a mentor? Harbour.Space will assist students in finding the most optimal mentor for the Capstone Project but is not responsible for the outcome. Please note that mentors are not assigned but are instead courted. As a rule, it will take a while to convince the best mentors to become advisors on your project. The more developed the project is when the mentor is contacted, the higher the chances of success. Every member of our teaching faculty can become a mentor based on their past experiences, so be conscious about this while taking courses, and impress visiting faculty with your work ethics, passion and commitment. Do I get a job placement upon graduation? The majority of our students receive multiple job offers at the end of the second academic year of their Bachelor’s programme and the end of the first academic year of their Master’s programme. The best applicants receive an offer from our industrial partners. What if I want to start my own company? We are eager to work with students looking to become entrepreneurs and start their businesses. If you have a strong desire to be an entrepreneur, you need to gain the skills and knowledge required to develop a successful startup company:
    • Core management, leadership, and team skills, as well as an opportunity to hone your technical skills.
    • Support and guidance from our mentors with specialised knowledge in technology, entrepreneurship, company building, and venture capital.
    • Ability to enter one of the world’s best accelerators and compete for funding for your startup business.
    • Possibility of presenting your company at local and international startup events as well as pitching in front of our partner VC funds.
    • Students will get an early start on building a startup by trying out their ideas as part of their capstone project implementation. Students and their mentors work on the project for the duration of the programme and have an opportunity to study the project idea from multiple perspectives and try out different approaches. Students can also use this time to learn about market demand, the challenges of building a functioning team and familiarize themselves with all steps necessary to start a company.
    • At the end of the programme students present their projects during Demo Day. The presentation will be held in front of peers, professors, as well as industry and venture capital representatives. It is an excellent opportunity to make a big splash and attract the worldâ€™s attention to your startup. We are excited to give students an opportunity to make their last day at Harbour.Space the first birthday of their startup.
    Do I need a visa? All students from non-European Union countries, non-European Economic Area member state countries and not from the Swiss Confederation must obtain a student visa. The student visa allows the holder to remain in Spain in order to seek studies, research, and internship programmes.

    Zeptolab

    • Marketing Performance

    Location

    • Bangkok

    Duration

    • 1 Year Full-Time

    Start Date

    • 3 Aug 2021

    Application Deadline

    • 30 June 2021

    Application closes in

fa-quote-right","library":"fa-solid"},"ekit_testimonial_rating_enable":"","ekit_testimonial_data":[{"client_name":"Pedro Bare","_id":"e31e837","designation":"Junior Interaction Designer","review":"I don't think I'd be where am at now professionally if it wasn't for the education I received at Harbour Space. To produce your best work as a designer you have to be (1) Surrounded by ambitious peers striving to create great work (2) Receive guidance and instruction from practitioners that will push you beyond your comfort zone- Harbour Space did that for me and I'm forever grateful for the experience I had as a student there.","client_photo":{"url":"http://localhost/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/Pedro.png","id":95,"alt":"","source":"library"}},{"client_name":"Diego Gladig","_id":"ae8d276","designation":"Co-Founder, CFO","review":"What a great year! Having done my Bachelors at the University of St. Gallen in Switzerland, it was a hard decision for me to come to Barcelona and study at Harbour.Space. However, after one year I can say that it was more than worth it. I have learned a lot about how to set up a company, heavily extended my network with decision-makers, met incredible classmates from all over the world and also learned 3 new programming languages (without being a data / computer science student).","client_photo":{"url":"http://localhost/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/Diego.png","id":96,"alt":"","source":"library"}},{"client_name":"Pavithra Krishnan","_id":"0e80288","designation":"Product Designer","review":"The Interaction design Masters program has Industry leaders from Google, Anton & Irene, Friends, spending over 3 weeks with us to teach some really great modules. Quitting my job and moving to Barcelona was one of the best decisions I’ve made. I would recommend Harbour.Space to anyone who is open to challenging themselves.","client_photo":{"url":"http://localhost/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/Pavithra.png","id":97,"alt":"","source":"library"}},{"_id":"6e277e1","client_name":"Soninke Combrinck","designation":"UX Designer","review":"Wow! What an enriching educational experience! Coming from a journalism background in South Africa, I was interested in how to use interactive media to tell better stories. After learning from the best of the best, from creative geniuses from all around the world and constantly being pushed to improve and grow, I found my calling. Harbour.Space is the experience of a lifetime with unforgettable people and is well worth a shot.","client_photo":{"url":"http://localhost/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/Soninke.png","id":98,"alt":"","source":"library"}}],"ekit_testimonial_slidetoshow":1.5,"ekit_testimonial_speed":1400,"ekit_testimonial_layout_background_background":"classic","ekit_testimonial_layout_background_color":"#F1F0F4","ekit_testimonial_section_wathermark_color":"#422E5991"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"elementskit-testimonial"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false},{"id":"2ce6ecf0","elType":"section","settings":{"gap":"no","html_tag":"section","background_background":"classic","background_color":"#ffffff","padding":{"unit":"em","top":"4","right":"0","bottom":"4","left":"0","isLinked":false},"padding_mobile":{"unit":"em","top":"3","right":"1","bottom":"3","left":"1","isLinked":false},"ma_el_slider_delay":"5000"},"elements":[{"id":"8b1f324","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":100,"_inline_size":null,"_inline_size_tablet":100,"space_between_widgets":10,"background_background":"classic","background_color":"#ffffff","box_shadow_box_shadow":{"horizontal":0,"vertical":0,"blur":5,"spread":0,"color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.33)"},"margin":{"unit":"%","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false},"padding":{"unit":"em","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false},"padding_mobile":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false},"ma_el_slider_delay":"5000"},"elements":[{"id":"1726f813","elType":"section","settings":{"content_width":{"unit":"px","size":700,"sizes":[]},"padding":{"unit":"em","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false},"ma_el_slider_delay":"5000"},"elements":[{"id":"f91002f","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":100,"_inline_size":null,"ma_el_slider_delay":"5000"},"elements":[{"id":"57c1aac0","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"id":300,"url":"http://localhost/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/Sketch002.png2_-e1634190194916.jpg","alt":"","source":"library"},"align":"center","width":{"unit":"%","size":10,"sizes":[]},"width_mobile":{"unit":"%","size":21,"sizes":[]},"_margin":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false},"_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"1070","height":"1070"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"image"},{"id":"bc0dbb7","elType":"widget","settings":{"title":"frequently
asked questions","align_mobile":"left","title_color":"#422E59","typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_family":"Palanquin Dark","typography_font_size":{"unit":"rem","size":3},"typography_font_size_mobile":{"unit":"em","size":2.4},"typography_font_weight":"900","typography_text_transform":"uppercase","typography_line_height":{"unit":"em","size":0.9},"typography_letter_spacing":{"unit":"px","size":4},"_margin":{"unit":"%","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false},"_animation":"fadeIn","align":"center"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"heading"},{"id":"27a6f29f","elType":"widget","settings":{"weight":{"unit":"px","size":6,"sizes":[]},"color":"#52f28a","width":{"unit":"%","size":9,"sizes":[]},"gap":{"unit":"px","size":5,"sizes":[]},"_margin":{"unit":"%","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false},"align":"center","align_mobile":"left","text":"Divider"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"divider"},{"id":"517671e2","elType":"widget","settings":{"text_color":"#979cb2","typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_family":"Palanquin","typography_font_size":{"unit":"em","size":1.1,"sizes":[]},"align":"center","typography_font_weight":"400","typography_text_transform":"none","typography_font_style":"normal","typography_text_decoration":"none","typography_line_height":{"unit":"em","size":1.5,"sizes":[]},"editor":""},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"}],"isInner":true}],"isInner":true},{"id":"38b1c1be","elType":"section","settings":{"ma_el_slider_delay":"5000"},"elements":[{"id":"2132a66d","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":100,"_inline_size":null,"ma_el_slider_delay":"5000"},"elements":[{"id":"15af2c92","elType":"widget","settings":{"tabs":[{"tab_title":"Will I have a mentor?","tab_content":"Harbour.Space will assist students in finding the most optimal mentor for the Capstone Project but is not responsible for the outcome. Please note that mentors are not assigned but are instead courted. As a rule, it will take a while to convince the best mentors to become advisors on your project. The more developed the project is when the mentor is contacted, the higher the chances of success. Every member of our teaching faculty can become a mentor based on their past experiences, so be conscious about this while taking courses, and impress visiting faculty with your work ethics, passion and commitment.","_id":"22c349c"},{"tab_title":"Do I get a job placement upon graduation?","tab_content":"The majority of our students receive multiple job offers at the end of the second academic year of their Bachelor's programme and the end of the first academic year of their Master's programme. The best applicants receive an offer from our industrial partners.","_id":"79e257d"},{"tab_title":"What if I want to start my own company?","tab_content":"We are eager to work with students looking to become entrepreneurs and start their businesses. If you have a strong desire to be an entrepreneur, you need to gain the skills and knowledge required to develop a successful startup company:
  • Core management, leadership, and team skills, as well as an opportunity to hone your technical skills.
  • Support and guidance from our mentors with specialised knowledge in technology, entrepreneurship, company building, and venture capital.
  • Ability to enter one of the world's best accelerators and compete for funding for your startup business.
  • Possibility of presenting your company at local and international startup events as well as pitching in front of our partner VC funds.
  • Students will get an early start on building a startup by trying out their ideas as part of their capstone project implementation. Students and their mentors work on the project for the duration of the programme and have an opportunity to study the project idea from multiple perspectives and try out different approaches. Students can also use this time to learn about market demand, the challenges of building a functioning team and familiarize themselves with all steps necessary to start a company.
  • At the end of the programme students present their projects during Demo Day. The presentation will be held in front of peers, professors, as well as industry and venture capital representatives. It is an excellent opportunity to make a big splash and attract the world’s attention to your startup. We are excited to give students an opportunity to make their last day at Harbour.Space the first birthday of their startup.
","_id":"ceb30d6"},{"_id":"11afd8d","tab_title":"Do I need a visa?","tab_content":"All students from non-European Union countries, non-European Economic Area member state countries and not from the Swiss Confederation must obtain a student visa. The student visa allows the holder to remain in Spain in order to seek studies, research, and internship programmes."}],"title_color":"#979cb2","tab_active_color":"#422E59","content_typography_typography":"custom","content_typography_font_size":{"unit":"em","size":1},"content_typography_line_height":{"unit":"em","size":1.6},"icon":"fa
